t: Psalm 7
Prayer for Justice
A Shiggaion of David, which he sang to the Lord concerning the words of Cush, a Benjaminite.
Lord*spn my God, I seek refuge in you; save*ln me from all my pursuers and rescue me,
or*ln they will tear me like a lion, ripping*ln me apart with no one to rescue me.
Lord*spn my God, if I have done this, if*ln there is injustice on my hands,
if*ln I have done harm to one at peace with me or*ln have plundered my adversary without cause,
may*ln an enemy pursue and overtake me; may*ln he trample me to the ground and*ln leave my honor in the dust. Selah*ig
Rise*pn up, Lord,*s in your anger; lift*ln yourself up against the fury of my adversaries; awake*ln for me; you*ln have ordained a judgment.
Let*ln the assembly of peoples gather around you; take*ln your seat on high over it.
The*ln Lord*s judges the peoples; vindicate*ln me, Lord,*s according*ln to my righteousness and my integrity.
Let*pn the evil of the wicked come to an end, but*ln establish the righteous. The*ln one who examines the thoughts and emotions is*ln a righteous God.
My*ln shield is with God, who*ln saves the upright in heart.
God*ln is a righteous judge and*ln a God who shows his wrath every day.
If*pn anyone does not repent, he*ln will sharpen his sword; he*ln has strung his bow and made it ready.
He*ln has prepared his deadly weapons; he*ln tips his arrows with fire.
See,*pn the wicked one is pregnant with evil, conceives*ln trouble, and gives birth to deceit.
He*ln dug a pit and hollowed it out but*ln fell into the hole he had made.
His*ln trouble comes back on his own head; his*ln own violence comes down on top of his head.
I*pn will thank the Lord*s for his righteousness; I*ln will sing about the name of the Lord*s Most High.
